# Requirements

For the fill cart, the data acquisition requirements are:
- Must allow reading from load cells, thermocouples, and pressure transducers
- Must be modular and allow to easily add new sensors
- Reading from each sensor must be self-contained
	- e.g. reading from load cells shouldn't require external amplifiers
- Must be resistant to the elements (dust and water)
- Must be able to be operated from a distance
- Must log all data for future analysis
- Must send data to a remote ground station for live monitoring

> TODO: Data rate requirements? 

> TODO: Rocket data logging requirements?

# Alternatives

## DIY (Hydra)

- Module-based system
- Communicate with a logging board using CAN-FD
- Data logging is done right on the board, allowing higher data rates
- The logging board and modules are connected directly to each other, no wires between the two

```diagram

```


## CompactRIO

https://www.ni.com/en-ca/shop/compactrio.html

- Module-based system
- Made by NI
- Sponsorship possible
- Possible to control other components
- Standalone

Questions:
- How to view data remotely?
- If Hydra is used for control, how to integrate the two?
- Any software licenses we would have to deal with?
- How do we program this thing?
